message.content:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: 
try {
    writer.write(document.getElementById("1").outerHtml() + "\n");
    writer.write(document.getElementsByTag("script").get(0).outerHtml() + "\n");
    writer.write(document.getElementsByClass("class1").outerHtml() + "\n");
    writer.write(document.getElementsByClass("class2").outerHtml() + "\n");
} catch (Exception e) {
    e.printStackTrace();
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the getElementsByTag method of the Document class to get the script tags. This method returns an Elements object (which is a list of Element objects). You can then get the first script tag by calling the get method on the Elements object with 0 as the argument. Finally, you can get the outer HTML of the script tag by calling the outerHtml method on the Element object.
